text:
TV Magazine BIG BUCKS How much are the Celebrity Big Brother 2017 cast paid and what does the winner get? Housemate pay deals revealed 
The stars got some pretty tidy sums to appear on the show BY GEORGINA LITTLEJOHN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CELEBRITIES appearing on reality TV shows rarely give their time for free including those who appeared on the latest series of Celebrity Big Brother. 
And some of their fees were pretty eye-watering to say the least! 
So how much did this year’s motley crew get paid? And how do they compare to celebrity fees in previous series? Here’s what we know. Fame Flynet Spencer and Heidi, AKA Speidi, were reportedly been paid £570,000 between them to return to CBB Speidi aka Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt 
They were the first pair to enter the CBB house as part of the ‘All Stars’ group, having previously been on the show in 2013 and coming in second to winner Rylan Clark. 
The reality TV couple , who married in 2009, are reportedly earning £570,000 between them for their return stint on the show. Ray J 7 Kim K’s ex Ray J is believed to be the highest-paid CBB housemate so far 
For the rapper’s first time in Celebrity Big Brother he was part of the ‘New Stars’ gang. 
Bosses hoped he’d spill the beans about his relationship with Kim Kardashian so reportedly gave him £810,000- that’s $1million – for his appearance. 
That would make him the highest-paid CBB housemate ever. Not only that, but according to TMZ, producers have also covered his £24,000 travel and hotel costs while he’s in the UK. 
However, his time in the show proved to be short-lived – Ray J left the show after a week in the house , after reportedly “blacking out” as a result of intense toothache which saw him rushed to hospital. PA:Press Association James Jordan was been given a six-figure sum to appear James Jordan 
Like Speidi, James was a returning housemate , and, as revealed by the Sun, he was given a six-figure deal to come back after he first appeared on the show in 2014. 
An show insider said: “The producers loved how feisty he was when he appeared on Celebrity Big Brother in 2014 and they know he won’t hold back.” Jedward 
The X Factor twins made a return to the house , as exclusively revealed by the Sun, after they took part in the show in 2011. 
The Irish stars were reportedly paid £500,000 each six years ago so that can only have gone up considerably for their second stint on the show. Splash News Jedward were the shock returning housemates What does the winner get? 
There is no prize fund up for grabs in Celebrity Big Brother, but it’s been reported the winner could make £1million through endorsements, personal appearances and product placements. 
Marketing expert Rob Cooper told The Mirror: “To win the show is like being giving validation that you have a huge fan base who are buying into you via vote lines, which is very enticing to 
endorsers, bookers and producers.” Who are the winners of Celebrity Big Brother? 2011 – Paddy Doherty
